Yuyi Zhong
dcterms:description: The NDSS18 dataset is a compilation of binary functions derived from the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) and the Software Assurance Reference Dataset (SARD) project. It includes a total of 32,281 binary functions compiled using Windows and Linux, featuring two types of Common Weakness Enumerations (CWEs): CWE119 and CWE399.
dcterms:title: NDSS18 Dataset

dcterms:description: The Juliet Test Suite is a collection of 81,000 test cases in C/C++ and Java from NIST that contain 112 different Common Weakness Enumerations (CWEs). It is used for evaluating vulnerability detection tools.
dcterms:title: Juliet Test Suite

dcterms:description: The FFmpeg dataset is an open-source suite of libraries written in C for handling media files, such as video and audio. It includes vulnerabilities collected from various commits on GitHub, compiled into binary code for vulnerability detection.
dcterms:title: FFmpeg Dataset

dcterms:creator: Yaniv David
Nimrod Partush
Eran Yahav
dcterms:description: The Esh dataset contains CVE cases collected by David et al. (2016), which include various CVEs. It features a highly imbalanced distribution of vulnerabilities, representing a realistic scenario for vulnerability detection.
dcterms:title: Esh Dataset
